block_comment: This block of code primarily performs address timing checks on a specific bit of the input address. More specifically, it uses an always block to monitor/trigger on changes to the 10th bit (considering a 0 index) of the input address 'addr_in'. When such a change is detected, the 'cmd_addr_timing_check' function is called with the constant value '16'. This function performs timing checks on the given address bit, providing validation for the address timing operation.
